701372f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (foreground, not seen), east side, between its junction with Kappock Street and its junction with Irwin Ave., showing a duck
pond.
October 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
701372f-a.folder: Johnson Avenue & Kappock Street, Bronx, NY

701370f.text:
Johnson Ave., west from but not including Kappock Street. The lower part of the Henry Hudson Bridge is visible in the background.
November 12, 1936.
Works Progress Administration.
Federal Art Project photo.
701370f.folder: Johnson Avenue & Kappock Street, Bronx, NY

701369f-a.text:
Johnson Avenue, near Kappock Street.
May 19th, 1937
W.P.A. Photo
Five Boroughs Project

701368f-a.text:
Johnson Avenue, at Kappock Street, looking northward. Johnson Avenue continues northward around the right side of the house seen in the center of the view; Kappock Street commences at the fence (left), this side of the school building and skirts the house to the left. The school is Public School No. 24. This area is on Spuyten Duyvil Hill.
October 7, 1927
P. L. Sperr
Neg. No. 95
(2)
The same, years 1ater.
July 15, 1939
P. L. Sperr
Neg. No. 95
